sections.heading: What is 〜てはだめ?
sections.content:
〜てはだめ is a casual way to express prohibition, meaning "must not," "can't," or "don't." It's softer and more colloquial than てはいけない.

食べてはだめ "You can't eat" / "Don't eat" 行ってはだめだよ "You mustn't go"

children.heading: Pattern: Verb て-form + は + だめ(です)
children.content: | Verb | て-form | + はだめ | | ------ | ------- | ------------ | | 食べる | 食べて | 食べてはだめ | | 行く | 行って | 行ってはだめ | | 見る | 見て | 見てはだめ | | する | して | してはだめ |

children.heading: Contraction: 〜ちゃだめ
children.content:
Common in casual speech:

食べてはだめ → 食べちゃだめ 行ってはだめ → 行っちゃだめ してはだめ → しちゃだめ 見てはだめ → 見ちゃだめ

sections.heading: だめ vs いけない
sections.content:
| Feature | だめ | いけない | | --------- | ------------------ | ------------- | | Formality | Casual | More formal | | Tone | Friendlier | Stricter | | Usage | Daily conversation | Rules, formal |

Casual: 食べちゃだめ Formal: 食べてはいけません Both mean: "You mustn't eat"

children.heading: Giving warnings/advice
children.content: それ触っちゃだめ！ "Don't touch that!" 一人で行ってはだめだよ "You mustn't go alone" そんなこと言っちゃだめ "You can't say such things"

children.heading: Parental/friendly prohibition
children.content: 危ないからだめ！ "No, because it's dangerous!" まだ食べちゃだめ "You can't eat yet" 遅くまで起きてちゃだめ "You shouldn't stay up late"

children.heading: Very Casual
children.content: 食べちゃだめ "Don't eat" 行っちゃだめ "Don't go" 見ちゃだめ "Don't look"

children.heading: Casual Polite
children.content: 食べてはだめです "You can't eat" (polite but casual) 行ってはだめですよ "You mustn't go"

children.heading: Explanation with だめ
children.content: だめなんです "It's not allowed" だめなの "You can't" (explaining)

children.heading: Example 1: Parent and Child
children.content: A: ママ、これ食べてもいい？ "Mom, can I eat this?" B: だめだめ、まだ夕飯前よ "No no, it's still before dinner" A: えー、少しだけ？ "Aww, just a little?" B: だめって言ってるでしょ "I said no, didn't I"

children.heading: Example 2: Between Friends
children.content: A: 一人で行ってくるね "I'll go alone" B: ちょっと待って！一人で行っちゃだめだよ "Wait! You can't go alone" A: 大丈夫だって "It'll be fine" B: だめだって。一緒に行くから "No way. I'll go with you"

children.heading: Example 3: At Home
children.content: A: ゲームしてもいい？ "Can I play games?" B: 宿題終わった？ "Did you finish homework?" A: まだ... "Not yet..." B: じゃあだめ。宿題が先 "Then no. Homework first"

children.heading: Just "だめ" as response
children.content: A: これ使ってもいい？ "Can I use this?" B: だめ "No" / "You can't" A: 明日は？ "How about tomorrow?" B: 明日もだめ "Tomorrow's no good either"

children.heading: Adding particles for softer tone
children.content: 食べちゃだめだよ "You can't eat (I'm telling you)" 行っちゃだめだからね "You can't go, okay?" 触っちゃだめって言ったでしょ "I told you not to touch it, right?"

children.heading: だめだよ / だめだ
children.content: それはだめだよ "That's no good" 絶対だめだ "Absolutely not" どうしてもだめ？ "Is it really not possible?"

children.heading: だめなの
children.content:
Explanation form:

なんでだめなの？ "Why not?" / "Why can't I?" 今はだめなの "Not now" / "You can't right now"

children.heading: Explaining why it's だめ
children.content: 危ないからだめ "No, because it's dangerous" まだ早いからだめ "No, because it's still early" お金がないからだめ "No, because there's no money"

children.heading: てはだめ (casual prohibition)
children.content: 食べちゃだめ "Don't eat" (casual, friendly)

children.heading: てはいけない (formal prohibition)
children.content: 食べてはいけません "You must not eat" (formal, strict)

children.heading: ないでください (polite request)
children.content: 食べないでください "Please don't eat" (polite request)

children.heading: ないほうがいい (advice)
children.content: 食べないほうがいい "It's better not to eat" (advice)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using in formal situations
children.content: Wrong context: 上司に「それはだめです」 ⚠️ Better: 「申し訳ございませんが...」 ✓ "I'm sorry but..." だめ is too casual for superiors!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong conjugation
children.content: Wrong: 食べるはだめ ❌ Right: 食べてはだめ ✓ "You can't eat" Must use て-form!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with できない
children.content: だめ = not allowed (prohibition) できない = cannot (ability) 食べちゃだめ = "You can't eat" (not allowed) 食べられない = "I can't eat" (unable to)

children.heading: 絶対だめ (absolutely not)
children.content: 絶対に触っちゃだめ！ "You absolutely must not touch!" 絶対だめだからね "It's absolutely not allowed, okay?"

children.heading: 〜たらだめ (if you do, it's bad)
children.content: 遅刻したらだめだよ "You can't be late" (If you're late, it's bad) 忘れたらだめ "Don't forget" (If you forget, it's bad)

children.heading: As adjective (no good)
children.content: この案はだめだ "This plan is no good" もうだめだ "It's hopeless / I'm done for"

children.heading: As permission denial
children.content: A: いい？ "Is it okay?" B: だめ "No"

children.heading: As impossibility
children.content: もう歩けない。だめだ "I can't walk anymore. I'm done"

sections.heading: Repeated だめ for Emphasis
sections.content: だめだめだめ！ "No, no, no!" だめったらだめ！ "I said no!"

sections.heading: Written Style
sections.content:
In writing, だめ is usually written in hiragana:

Hiragana: だめ (common) Kanji: 駄目 (less common) Katakana: ダメ (emphasis/casual)

children.heading: Using だめ to state rules
children.content: ここは禁煙だから、吸っちゃだめ "This is non-smoking, so you can't smoke" まだ子供だから、見ちゃだめ "You're still a child, so you can't watch"

children.heading: 〜てはだめですか？
children.content: 食べてはだめですか？ "Can't I eat?" / "Is eating not allowed?" 行っちゃだめ？ "Can't I go?"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: それ触っちゃだめ "Don't touch that" ここで遊んじゃだめ "You can't play here" 嘘をついちゃだめだよ "You mustn't lie"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: まだ宿題終わってないでしょ？ゲームしちゃだめ "You haven't finished homework yet, right? You can't play games" 一人で夜道を歩いちゃだめだよ "You can't walk alone on night streets" そんなに食べちゃだめ。お腹壊すよ "Don't eat so much. You'll get a stomachache"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 危ないから絶対に近づいちゃだめだからね "It's dangerous, so absolutely don't go near it, okay?" この秘密は誰にも言っちゃだめだよ。約束して "You can't tell this secret to anyone. Promise" 諦めちゃだめ！まだチャンスはあるから "Don't give up! There's still a chance"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜てはいけない - Must not (formal) 〜ないでください - Please don't 〜てもいい - May/Permission 〜ないほうがいい - Better not to て-form - Te-form conjugation Prohibition expressions - Various prohibition forms
